fields.description:
When doing certain operations in a repo (ex : Fetch, Pull, etc. ...) or sometimes when the automatic refresh takes place, the left side menu showing my repo's branches and the remote repo's branches collapses. This is very annoying since I usually change between branches often and having the list of branches collapsed all the time is very annoying.

This is something that changed in the 2-3 latest releases. The first version 2.x did not have that bug and the version 1.x never had any issue similar to that.
fields.summary: Sourcetree left side UI collapses automatically

fields.description:
When using the "rebase children interactively" menu function, the "squash commits" functions is buggy:

1) Squashing more than two commits in a single interactive rebase still shows "[2 commits]" and does not correctly update the title of the commit (see screenshots)

2) Sometimes after pressing "OK" to start the rebase, SourceTree only squashes the last 2 commits, even if multiple ones are selected to be squashed. I have not been able to replicate this
fields.summary: In interactive rebase, squashing more than 2 commits still shows "[2 commits]"

fields.description: I love how easy and fast it is to update SourceTree 2.x. But when it asks me if I want to update, I'd like to have an easy way to view release notes before saying "yes".
fields.summary: Add button/link to view release notes before updating

fields.description:
Pressing Ctrl + Shift + C (keyboard shortcut for Actions → Commit Selectetd…) stages all unstaged files. In previous versions of SourceTree, it used to just bring the commit box without touching unstaged files. With this new behavior, I keep committing everything even when I carefully staged some files and some lines.

Please revert to the previous behavior.
fields.summary: Actions → Commit Selectetd… stages everything
Left Menu looks bad

fields.description:
We started using sourcetree with our old vb6 projects.
 
 I added "ignorecase = true" in my git config file, but sourcetree still shows me differences that is only case.
 We have to now search out the real changes and just press the stage hunk button.
 
 Thanks in advance

 

---

 
h3. Summary

ignorecase = true is not working on ST. The customer still can see differences that are only case.
h3. Investigation Done
 * I suggested to the customer set ignorecase globally if it wasn’t. He said he don’t want it global and it was already set to the specific repo
 * Customer switched from embedded Git to System Git but no difference
 * SourceTree was updated to version 2.1.2.3 but the issue persists

h3. Please see: https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/STSP-7146
fields.summary: Git config setting "ignorecase = true" is not working.

fields.description: Issue occured when navigating to some older branch. I was shown "fetching older commits" notification (see: [https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/STSP-7101)]
fields.summary: Mismatch in branch colors when navigating to old commits

fields.description:
How can I set merge base on source tree? 
 
 Why the default setting is first parent and this is ridiculous? With this setting, all changes are mixed together and this causes me a lot of trouble when resolving conflicts.
fields.summary: Unable to set custom merge base

fields.description:
I have upgraded to SourceTree v2.0.20.1 on Windows 10 after the security warning about older versions today.
 
 The problem I am having is that when I try to pull changes down from bitbucket for the repository I am working on it says "No changes to pull" despite there definitely being changes to pull. I have tried deleting all settings and logging in with the bitbucket OAuth again but it's the same

 

-----

 

I am using System Mercurial v3.9.2. I am using OAuth with bitbucket, setup from the options window in sourcetree - although I think it has the same issue when using basic password auth as well.

It might be worth noting that I have what looks like a bugged authentication section as you can see in the screenshot - the bottom entry looks strange to me. Also I cannot delete any of these, when I click delete and confirm they just stay there (I have included a 2nd screenshot to show what it looks like after trying to delete all the passwords and restarting sourcetree)

 

see: https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/STSP-6937
fields.summary: Cannot pull or push changes (Authentication with Mercurial)

fields.description:
When using using 2.0.20.1 the 'Clone from SourceTree' creates a new binding between sourcetree:// and SourceTree\app-2.0.20.1.

After an application update this binding is then invalid, as it has not been updated to SourceTree\app-2.1.2.4.

To fix it you need to hack the registry, this is not acceptable in a large deployment.

The protocol should link to a static path and not be depend on version, or at least to a "current version" symlink.
fields.summary: 'Clone from SourceTree' breaks after a version update.

fields.description: Upgraded to version 2.0.21 of SourceTree from using verison for quite some time; absolutely disappointed. This version is *sooo* slow. Every action has a good moments delay and keeps polling git in the background. What did you guys do!
fields.summary: Upgraded to latest sourceTree - regretting it!

fields.description:
* File History's looses focus of the selected file(s) on repository refreshing, but diff rolls to the beginning and it is still shown. There must be consistency (preferably file list reflects diff, since the other way around will disrupt reading if refresh happens randomly)

 
 * Sometimes diff-panel lags to the file previously selected - e.g. after random patterns (finishing on file x), selecting a, b, and c results in showing x, a, b (instead of a, b, and c)  (Might be related to: previous point). Only restart fixes this
fields.summary: File Status (tab) and File Selection (while on File Status tab)

fields.description: To reproduce the issue drag the ST window from one monitor to the top of the second monitor so that ST becomes maximised on the second monitor. This causes bits of the UI to bleed behind the task bar and onto the other monitor. Dragging ST to the top of the same monitor causes the UI to bleed behind the task bar, but not onto the second monitor.
fields.summary: Dragging the UI to maximise it "bleeds" the UI

fields.description: Set Commit Text links in-program settings (i.e. global) in addition to per-repository settings
fields.summary: Set Commit Text links in-program in addition to per-repository

fields.description: Refresh Custom Actions immediately after changing them in settings, instead only of F5 (depending on tab) or full restart
fields.summary: Refresh Custom Actions immediately

fields.description: Save prepared commit message that's not yet commited, even between program restarts
fields.summary: Save prepared commit message

fields.description: After hours of working with SourceTree, operations are sluggish. Restart required
fields.summary: After hours of working with SourceTree, operations are sluggish. Restart required

fields.description: Whitespace-only lines should be easier differentiable (e.g. changing font instead of background)
fields.summary: Whitespace-only lines should be easier differentiable (e.g. changing font instead of background)

fields.description: Discarding an Untracked difference occasionally changes crlf to lf in saved file
fields.summary: Discarding an Untracked difference changes crlf to lf in saved file

fields.description:
Setup: One staged, one unstaged file: in Split View Staging: Flat list.

1) Select a staged file

2) Press F5 (to refresh, causing the file to be deselected) This may also happen due to an internal refresh which happen frequently.

The staged file will appear deselected, it is NOT internally.

Selecting an unstaged file will NOT cause the stage file to be unselected internally.

 

Example of very bad behavior (after steps 1 & 3) 

3) Selected an unstaged file. (at this point only 1 file appears selected in the lists)

4) Choose Discard from the right click context menu.

5) Observer two files selected in the discard warning popup

6) If discard is OK'd both files go away

 

This is an absolute show stopper as it can result in major work loss unexpectedly, or introducing unintended changes.

I expect this 'selection' bug to affect any operation which operates on the selected files.
fields.summary: GUI refresh corrupts the internal file selection state.

fields.description: Can you please display Tags on the graph in a different way. In our repositories, for a given commit, there might be more than three Tags. We use a hierarchical Tag naming scheme to separate / order Tags, and therefore Tag names can be quite long. For more than two Tags typically the commit text does not get displayed because of the amount of space the Tags consume. Please make use of ToolTips! Each Tag could be displayed with just the icon with the text being displayed in a ToolTip. Likewise the full (first line of) the commit text could be displayed in a ToolTip.
fields.summary: Display Tags on the graph in a different way

fields.description:
After upgrading to 2.1.2.4 (from a prompt by Sourcetree itself) and restarting Sourcetree, the UI is in french. However English is still shown as the language in Options.

This was also a problem for the last few upgrades I went through (don't know the version numbers though).

Workaround :
 # go to Options, set Language to Automatic, restart.
 # go to Options, set Language to English, restart.

This is a pretty strong deterrent to upgrading.
fields.summary: Language setting is disregarded after software upgrade

fields.description:
I installed SourceTree 2.0.20.1 for Windows with the new tab view and started it (no repos).

Main window ->Local repositiories -> Add Folder.

I added 2 folders and renamed them to "{color:#ff0000}Folder 1{color}" and "{color:#ff0000}Folder 2{color}", look 2017-06-12 13_08_33-SourceTree.png

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

bookmarks.xml after this action:
{code:java}
// <?xml version="1.0"?>
<ArrayOfTreeViewNode xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
  <TreeViewNode xsi:type="BookmarkFolderNode">
    <Level>0</Level>
    <IsExpanded>false</IsExpanded>
    <IsLeaf>false</IsLeaf>
    <Name>Folder 1</Name>
    <Children />
    <CanSelect>true</CanSelect>
  </TreeViewNode>
  <TreeViewNode xsi:type="BookmarkFolderNode">
    <Level>0</Level>
    <IsExpanded>false</IsExpanded>
    <IsLeaf>false</IsLeaf>
    <Name>New Folder</Name>
    <Children />
    <CanSelect>true</CanSelect>
  </TreeViewNode>
</ArrayOfTreeViewNode>
{code}
In the xml we have "{color:#ff0000}Folder 1{color}" and "{color:#ff0000}New Folder{color}".

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Then "Add a repository". In the "Local Folder" dropdown there is "*New Folder*" instead of "Folder 2", look 2017-06-12 13_09_21-SourceTree.png.   -> Bug

I aborted adding a repository and closed SourceTree.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

bookmarks.xml after closing:
{code:java}
// <?xml version="1.0"?>
<ArrayOfTreeViewNode xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
  <TreeViewNode xsi:type="BookmarkFolderNode">
    <Level>0</Level>
    <IsExpanded>false</IsExpanded>
    <IsLeaf>false</IsLeaf>
    <Name>Folder 1</Name>
    <Children />
    <CanSelect>true</CanSelect>
  </TreeViewNode>
  <TreeViewNode xsi:type="BookmarkFolderNode">
    <Level>0</Level>
    <IsExpanded>false</IsExpanded>
    <IsLeaf>false</IsLeaf>
    <Name>Folder 2</Name>
    <Children />
    <CanSelect>true</CanSelect>
  </TreeViewNode>
</ArrayOfTreeViewNode>
{code}
Now there is "*Folder 1*" and "*Folder 2*".

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

I started SourceTree again.

There is only the folder "All Repos", my newly created folders aren't there anymore!

-> Bug
fields.summary: Bookmarks "New Folder" problem

fields.description: When loading sourcetree 2.XX it consumes a lot of ram. closing it and starting it again with wifi disconnected solves the problem.  !sourcetree 2.JPG!!sourcetree.JPG!
fields.summary: On startup sourcetree consumes a lot of resources (memory)

fields.description:
After setting up OAuth, Source Tree works fine for couple of minutes. After few minutes, it starts giving 403 error. I do not have app passwords setup. I have done this multiple times since last two days.

Error is resolved with following steps..
 # Open Windows Credentials
 # Delete all [user@bitbucket.com|mailto:user@bitbucket.com] credentials
 # Restart Source Tree and
 # Open Authentication options
 # Refresh OAuth token
 # Now repository works for couple of minutes and then 403 error
fields.summary: 403 Error after few minutes of OAuth

fields.description: We have repository with lots of branches and tags. When I use JumpTo functionality it hangs for many seconds before showing the dropdown menu. But even if I do not use JumpTo but just create branches, refresh (F5) log, commit, the app hangs very frequently for several seconds. My guess is this is due to large number of branches and tags.
fields.summary: The app hangs for couple of seconds very frequently.

fields.description:
Clicking "Use an existing account" during installation brings up blank pop up.

Putting the mouse over the window shows the time icon, but nothing ever happens.
fields.summary: Clicking "Use an existing account" during installation brings up blank pop up

fields.description:
I don't remember what the previous version(s) of sourcetree had for this, but I seem annoyed by this default now so I'm assuming it wasn't this way before...

When someone has a lot of branches going on, chances are they don't have all of the up-to-date branches they're not working on.

Since there isn't a "Pull All" option I would think that "Push All" shouldn't be the default.

So every time I got to push the branch I'm working on I have to:
 * Press Push
 * Wait for the branches to all load (if I uncheck "Select All" too early it does nothing and re-checks itself)
 * Uncheck "Select All"
 * Check the branch I'm working on
 * Click Push

 

I would like to suggest either/or the following changes:
 * Remember the previous state of the "Select All" checkbox
 * By default only have the branch you are currently on checked
fields.summary: Change Push dialog window to have "Select All" un-checked by default
Alphabetical sorting of ALL repository views

fields.description:
I was trying to reorder commits by using Repository -> Interactive rebase... in SourceTree and got below error.

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c credential.helper=manager-st -c sequence.editor='C:\Users\whong\AppData\Local\SourceTree\app-2.0.20.1\tools\stree_gri' -c core.editor='C:\Users\whong\AppData\Local\SourceTree\app-2.0.20.1\tools\stree_gri' rebase -i --autosquash
 Rebasing (2/3)
 error: could not apply 8ff5c87... Commit #8

When you have resolved this problem, run "git rebase --continue".
 If you prefer to skip this patch, run "git rebase --skip" instead.
 To check out the original branch and stop rebasing, run "git rebase --abort".

Could not apply 8ff5c87... Commit #8

 

 

Auto-merging README.txt
 CONFLICT (content): Merge conflict in README.txt

Completed with errors, see above.
fields.summary: Reorder commits not working

fields.description:
I created an patch file from a full commit.  When I reapply the patch to another branch as a full commit, the first piece in the commit message that is contained in square brackets [] is stripped out.

When I edit the patch file, I can see the commit message with the square brackets in it.
fields.summary: Commit message in patch file is not correct when message contains []

fields.description:
New SourceTree versions are occasionally released with (sometimes serious) new bugs and issues which negatively affect large groups of users.

Atlassian can be slow to address and fix these bugs, with some of them hanging around, unresolved, in JIRA for months if not years.

Open sourcing the SourceTree code would allow the community to contribute to both fixing bugs and issues within the SourceTree product as well as introduce long requested new functionality.
fields.summary: Open source the SourceTree code

fields.description:
SourceTree stopped working suddenly and I tried to reinstall it. Problem is that when I uninstall and lauch the installer provided on [https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/,]

I have no install window launching and got the same files I had before uninstall that doesn't work. I tried deleting all SourceTree files on computer and follow the different solution proposed online but still nothing would work.
fields.summary: Can't reinstall manually SourceTree

fields.description:
We are using a lot of submodules in our repositories. When I am switching between branches It takes from 50sec to 2-4 minutes for every switching!

I needn't update submodules *recursive* every time, because they are changing very seldom and it takes too many time.

I found there was an option

[https://blog.sourcetreeapp.com/page/4/]
 * New repository option to disable recursive submodule operations

But I can't find this option in current version SourceTree 2 for Windows! Without this option our working process with SourceTree often like as hell ((

Many of my colleagues are forced to switch to other GUI programs for this reason...

I found similar discussion with such trouble:

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/SourceTree-questions/Recursive-submodule-checkout-on-every-branch-switch/qaq-p/211723?posted=595255#U595255]

Correct this trouble please or add an option to disable *recursive* modules updates when switching branches

Thanks
fields.summary: Extremely slow work when switching branches

fields.description:
I've updated to SourceTree v2.0.20.1 and since then, none of the SourceTree buttons on BitBucket.org seem to work (Branch -> Checkout In SourceTree, Repo -> Clone In SourceTree). I'm running Windows 10 and it has always worked fine. I've uninstalled and reinstalled SourceTree, and I've tried it across 3 different browsers - Firefox (default), Edge and Chrome.

I've also tried it across several repos.

I googled the issue and the only mention I could find was to tick the 'Use this version of SourceTree for URI association'. It was already ticked, and unticking / reticking made no difference.

The first time I clicked on one of the buttons in Edge and Chrome, it asked me if I wanted to open SourceTree - I clicked OK and nothing happened - SourceTree didn't open! I've tried using the buttons with SourceTree already open, but it still doesn't take me to the Clone / Checkout dialogs as it used to.

Is there some workaround for it in the meantime?
fields.summary: SourceTree button on BitBucket.org no longer working

fields.description: Program was hanging severely. Uninstalled and then downloaded the program from your link and it was a 2.0.19.1 version. This appears to not be a valid version? Tried to reinstall 1.10.23.1 and it presented the same error message.
fields.summary: install fails

fields.description:
When clicking on the cross button(close) I'm noticing that while the button is closed down it is... un-hiding the hidden "Windows style" close button instead of just showing the SourceTree one.

This doesnt occur for internal pop-ups, only the full window

Additionally Clicking and dragging over the buttons in different ways can bring up the rest of the minimize/maximize/close buttons, which only disappear when the SourceTree buttons are hovered over after releasing the mouse button.

These buttons are clickable

Reproducing steps

----------

Click and hold on Close button, and drag mouse down

Clicking different parts of the button may bring up different hidden buttons

 

--apologies I can't seem to attach images, button is similar to those seen when googling
"windows 98 close"
fields.summary: SourceTree Beta 2.1.4.0 - able to see minimize maximize and cross

fields.description: Current branch sorting is not good. Please change the sorting method using natural sort order.
fields.summary: Branch name sorting should use natural sort order

fields.description: Icons in repository tab don't line up with text correctly, if I open a repository tab up I get the same view as the attached image where they're slightly out of line. !icons_and_text_don't_line_up_correctly.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Icons in repository tab don't line up with text correctly

fields.description:
When the staging area is in the format: (Flat List Single Column or Tree View) + (Either Split or not split Staging)

Double clicking on a file in either the Staged / Unstaged areas will do nothing... Only right-clicking > Open will open the file.

 

Alternatively when the staging area is in the format: (Flat List Multi Column) + (Either Split or not split Staging)

Double clicking on a file in either the Staged / Unstaged areas will open the file as well as right-clicking > Open will open the file.

 

This is one of many many issues introduced in 2.x, Please do better testing before releasing new versions, it seems with each update that 1 bug is fixed and 5 more are added. For the last few years I have been using source tree it has been going consistently downhill.
fields.summary: Cannot double click staged file to open file in editor

fields.description: When clicking on any of the window control buttons (close, minimize, maximize), a second set of control buttons appear that also need to be clicked for the desired action to occur. Seems like there is a GUI issue here. It's not a huge issue, just a minor annoyance.
fields.summary: Minimize, maximize, and close button double up on main window
In the external diff tools dropdown add UltraCompare as an option (if detected present).

fields.description:
On the "file status" page, when staging files using space.
The confirmation popup is prompted and:
 * First time, the focus is on the "close" button: the popup is correctly closed with the Enter key.
 * Second time, the focus seems to be on the "close" button, but instead of closing the popup when pressing Enter, the focus is simply removed from the key (and goes to the commit button, which can lead to unwanted commit).

I could only reproduce this issue on the "File Status" pane. When staging several files from the "Log / History" pane, the focus works well.

This is preventing a full keyboard operation of the software  !/images/icons/emoticons/sad.png! .

ps: I don't know if it plays a role here, I'm using the "split view staging" to sort the files.
fields.summary: Wrong focus in the "File Status" page in the stage dialog confirmation pane

fields.description:
The Window Title Bar has the exact same colour and text colour, regardless of whether it's in focus or not. This changed with update to 2.0.

It means that you cannot tell whether or not the window is in focus, which effects the usage of both Sourcetree, and other applications in the window manager.
fields.summary: Window title bar not changing colour to indicate whether it's in focus.

fields.description:
Currently, when only one tab is open, you can't close it. This is not intuitive at all, and since the close button isn't disabled, it's probably a violation of both Windows and Mac UX guidelines (but I'm opening the bug here because I primarily use SourceTree on Windows).

What I'd like to see: if one tab is open, you allow it to close, and you close that tab and show the list of bookmarks in its place.
fields.summary: Suggestion for UI enhancement with only one tab open

fields.description:
The "Branches" tree is no longer expandable like the others ("Remotes", "Stashes", "Tags", "File Status") after upgrading (see screenshot).  This is happening on 3 of 4 open repository tabs, while the 4th tab still shows the dropdown caret.

!SourceTree_Missing_Branches_2_1_2_4.PNG!

fields.description: When doing every state-changing operation, such as a commit or a rebase, an Uncommited Changes node appears on top of the commit graph. It disappears after manually refreshing.

fields.description: When squashing more than two commits in the interactive rebase window, only the first few commits selected are actually squashed. This makes large rebase operations tedious and inconvenient. To reproduce, squash 4 or more commits in the interactive rebase window.
fields.summary: Squashing four or more commits only squashes the first few (2-3)

fields.description:
I write you to inform you about the latest update of our product ‚Source Tree'. I am enjoying using it and updated my version according to our security advisory from 10^th^ May to version 2.1.2.3.

While I do not have a problem, my collegue using recent version 2.1.2.4 has trouble to select the icons on the upper right corner (minimization, closing etc.). They are not selected clearly when the mouse moves above an icon.So the match between visual icon and mouseselection does not fit. Furthermore, the version does not work properly by commiting (remain in the commit windows). Although those are minor problems, we want to draw attention to it.
fields.summary: Selection via mouse not clearly marked

fields.description:
Updated to the latest sourcetree version about 1 month ago and it has been unusable ever since. CPU instantly shoots up to 100% as soon as I launch. I need to first close the program and then kills 10's of processes that it spawns. The longer I leave sourcetree open, the more processes it seems to create.

 

!image-2017-06-06-09-18-05-968.png!
fields.summary: 100% CPU usage "Git For Windows" Process

fields.description:
Issue is about the l eft column (File status, Branches, Tags, Remotes, Statshees)
 * Open one or several of  the menu items.
 * Open another active programme.
 * Come back to sourcetree, the list refreshes and CLOSES all the menu items.

This is frustrated because I'm talking with people of slack about some branches and my branches keep on closing.
fields.summary: Overview of Branches/Remotes closes after regaining focus.

fields.description:
In earlier versions closed branches were not shown in the branch-overview, no they are. This is quite annoying if you have a lot of closed branches.

Seems that something had changed. At least a switch to control that behaviour would be appreciated.
fields.summary: SourceTree shows closed hg-branches

fields.description:
When Sourcetree is opened the window is *always* out of bounds.

!image-2017-06-06-08-20-48-699.png!

!image-2017-06-06-08-22-37-165.png!

It's only a view pixels but the right and bottom border only have half of the scrollbars visible, so the user is ALWAYS forced to re-maximize the program to actually use it.

Please fix (and remember screen position correctly over a restart of the app!)

Thank you.
fields.summary: Window position always out-of-screen
Now repositories are displayed as team/repo instead of project/repo, and the project is not shown

fields.description:
After update to 2.1.2.4 and after uninstalling it and installing 2.0.20.1 this window is popups every time then st checks remote bitbucket reps.

 

!login.jpg!

Users can no longer copy selected lines from the primitive "diff view" on the right.

The app freezes when trying to copy and paste selected lines.

fields.description:
My desktop shortcut target is :C:\Users\MYUSERNAME\AppData\Local\SourceTree\Update.exe --processStart "SourceTree.exe"

In fact, these 2 exe files doesn't start SourceTree. To be able to start it, I need to throw back again the SourceTreeSetup-2.0.20.1.exe installation file downloaded from the website. 

Inside the SourceTree it keeps asking me if I would like ton install the 2.1.2.4 version. So it seems to download it, and it asking me to restart. ... so come the main problem I can't restart from the shortcut. So I restart with the installation file and no update has been done.

For some reason, I downloaded 2.0.19.1 and every time I launch SourceTree, it seems to crash after a few minutes

fields.description:
SourceTree notified me about available update. I confirmed update and after some time SourceTree proposed restart.

After restart I have to accept terms, login into attlassian account and configure online repository accounts.

This situations happens after every update.
fields.summary: Accounts data lost after any minor update

fields.description:
I was using Source Tree and it was working perfectly fine. Last week updated the Source Tree version to 2.0 and after that I am not able to connect with the code repository. My credentials are working fine I have cross verified with Atlassian and bitbucket.

 

Please look into this I am not able to pull or Push the code.

 

Thanks,

Anurag
fields.summary: I am getting error in SourceTree after updating to version 2.0 while connecting. It was working perfectly fine before version updates.

fields.description:
The new interface is nice enough, but I have a workflow where I leave all projects I've worked with open until I'm done with it for the day and everything has been committed. This allows me to know that some things still need to be committed to origin or not. I keep SourceTree open all the time when I am working.

But the new UI doesn't allow the last remaining tab to be closed. I'd like to be able to do that and have the display revert to the New Tab display when I have no project being actively worked on.
fields.summary: Add the ability to close the last tab

fields.description:
SourceTree keeps popping up new windows asking for git credential manager credentials.

 Customer doesn't see  git repositories and the are hosting  the VCS so we don't have any repositories in you cloud.
fields.summary: Using git svn will constantly prompt for  Credentials vis credentials manager

fields.description:
I have set up the global ignore file on the majority of users at my company, but one of the users it doesn't recognize the file. If I place the .gitignore file directly into the repository then it will work.This is causing a lot of unwanted files to appear as the user checks out environments which don't have the .gitignore file.

Any thoughts as to why the global ignore file isn't working.
fields.summary: Global ignore file not working

When I open my source tree on Windows 7, I enter my Atlassian account user name and password. After clicking Log in, nothing happens as shown in the picture attached below.

I uninstalled source tree, deleted folders and registry keys, but none of that has helped.
fields.summary: Logging into Atlassian account using SourceTree halts forever

fields.description:
Disable LibGit2 Integration (the Performance with having it enabled in this Version is very bad, refreshes take >10s).

!blob:D5C916A7-1E13-4D82-89E2-7B6410D537FB!

 

Although there are local branches:

!blob:1330274E-7814-4521-80C2-6E1007E56E87!

these branches are not displayed in the left tree view

!blob:95923D3A-2C78-47AD-8F96-59147DB63CBF!

and thus cannot be interacted with.
fields.summary: With disabled LibGit2, SourceTree shows no local branches

fields.description: After last update that icons (on attached screeen) work, but when I focus then it change to windows default, and it dificult to klick on right button.
fields.summary: Controlls button (close, minimize) dont' working right

fields.description:
Adding an existing repo to SourceTree causes SourceTree crashes.

*After I deleted the remote setting in config file, crash disappeared.*
fields.summary: Adding repo crash

fields.description:
Maximize the window.

Typical windows programs allow the window to be restored to a window and moved by clicking and dragging the title bar. See Notepad or Paint for examples. 

The behavior is equivalent to 'restore down' the window and beginning a drag with the window moved such that the clicked position on the title bar remains at the cursor position.
fields.summary: Can't move the window via title/menu bar drag when maximized.

fields.description:
The application window can't be resized using the mouse at the top edge. It appears that there is a 1 to 2 area at the top where the resize cursor/behavior normally would appear that does not support the drag behavior. This area does not allow the window to be dragged.

The major issue with the in ability to resize the window is that once the screen has bee docked it's height is set to the window height, and once the window has been moved it is very difficult to be able to get the bottom edge on the screen again for the purpose of making the window smaller.

Resizing the other three edges does work correctly.
fields.summary: Can't resize window using the top edge.

fields.description:
Viewing of the individual file(s) in either staging area can prove VERY frustrating...

Without warning or any specific set of circumstances the following can happen:
 * Clicking on file FOO.txt in the "Staged files" area will sometimes show the diff of file FOO.txt in the "Unstaged files" area (The opposite scenario also occurs)
 * Clicking on file FOO.txt in either staging area will sometimes ALSO show BAR.txt or INSTEAD show BAR.txt
 * In Unstaged file diff area, selecting multiple lines and pressing [Stage selected] or pressing [Stage hunk] will sometimes bring you to the Staged version of that file, leaving you to question whether the staging even worked properly (The opposite scenario also occurs)
 * In Unstaged file diff area, selecting multiple lines and pressing [Stage selected] or pressing [Stage hunk] will sometimes not do anything at all, pressing the stage button again will throw a git error saying something about not finding the lines in question (which means it was properly staged the first click, but not updated) (The opposite scenario also occurs)
 * etc...

 

This is one of many many issues introduced in 2.x, Please do better testing before releasing new versions, it seems with each update that 1 bug is fixed and 5 more are added. For the last few years I have been using source tree it has been going consistently downhill.
fields.summary: Viewing file diffs in staging areas is unreliable

fields.description:
Using then file selector on the General tab of Tools->Options, results in a path containing windows path separators, ie \*\ \*. OpenSSH expects unix path separators, ie \*/*, thus the configured key is not used by OpenSSH on startup.

Immediately after adding a given key it is used as expected by OpenSSH, but is ignored after a restart of SourceTree.

Manually changing the separators solves the problem, but the messages received while the path is in the incorrect format make it very difficult to pinpoint the root cause of the issue.
fields.summary: SSH key path selected in Tools->Options->General have the wrong path seperator

fields.description:
At installation of SourceTree 2.0.20.1 there is no install path asked.

And the default path is c:\users\<login>\appdata\local\ !

Which is not really a common location for installing software binaries, and is only accessible to one user.

=> impossible to have 2 users using SourceTree on a computer

=> impossible to install with an admin account ! (it's installed in the admin home path !)
fields.summary: Sourcetree 2.0.20.1 don't ask install path

fields.description:
Say I want to merge branch FOO into BAR
 * I have BAR checked out
 * I right-click on the latest FOO commit and select "Merge..."
 * If there is a merge conflict, then it shows the branches as if I am merging BAR into FOO
 * Not only the visuals are wrong, it also has all of the diffs backwards in the staging areas.
 * If I look at the actual code and/or use a visual merge tool it shows it correctly (FOO into BAR)

This is incredibly frustrating and misleading...

_EDIT: Just to clarify, even though all of the staging shows the merge backwards, once the merge is committed,_ it performs and shows the correct merge direction  _(FOO into BAR)_.

This is one of many many issues introduced in 2.x, Please do better testing before releasing new versions, it seems with each update that 1 bug is fixed and 5 more are added. For the last few years I have been using source tree it has been going consistently downhill
fields.summary: SourceTree 2.x has merge conflicts backwards
